alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 09 at 8:48PM MDT until May 10 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN EASTWARD TO THE EASTERN PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO FROM 11 AM MDT TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR WESTERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY EVENING DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Another round of gusty conditions is expected to impact central to eastern New Mexico on Tuesday where Red Flag conditions will redevelop. Winds will still be breezy in western New Mexico on Tuesday with elevated fire danger lingering there. Into Wednesday, winds will increase again areawide with critically low humidity expected over western and central areas of New Mexico. Above normal temperatures will also persist into the middle of the week along with high Haines indices that will yield very unstable conditions leading to rapid and potentially catastrophic fire spread and growth. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast and East Central Plains 11 AM to 9 PM Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts of 40 to 45 mph Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...4 to 9 percent with long durations of single digit relative humidities as well as poor overnight humidity recoveries. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly and will be very hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
